英文法規名稱: The Bylaw of Armaments Bureau, Ministry of National Defense
中文法規名稱: 國防部軍備局辦事細則
沿革內容:
1.The amended Article 29 was promulgated by the Ministry of National Defense Decree No. 0920000245 on 27 February 2003 and enforced on the aforementioned date.
2.The amended Article 4 and Article 5 were promulgated by the Ministry of National Defense Decree No. 0930001202 on 16 November 2004. 
3.The Decree of Decree No. 1010001131 of the Ministry of National Defense of the Ministry of National Defense of the People's Republic of China on December 30

法規內容.條文內容: The bylaw is formulated in accordance with Article 14 of the Organic Rule of Armaments Bureau (hereafter called the Rule).
Armaments Bureau (hereafter called the Bureau) shall perform its functions in accordance with the bylaw. To issues not regulated by the bylaw, other laws and regulations may apply affairs.

The Bureau consists of Divisions of Program Evaluation, Technology and Industry, Procurement Management, Acquisition Management, Construction and Facility; and Offices of Management Information, General Administration, and Comptroller (hereafter called major units). Each has its share of functions prescribed by the Rule and the bylaw.
Chapter (2) Division of Functions
Under the command of the Director-and Deputy Director-Generals, chiefs of major units direct subordinates to perform their functions.

Except crucial or special issues, chiefs of major units may, in accordance with divisions of responsibilities, issue the Bureau’s documents and submit a weekly report to the director-and (or) deputy director-generals for review.
With the approval of the Minister or other authorized superiors, the Bureau may prepare the Ministry’s documents.

The Bureau performs its functions through a system of division of responsibilities. The functions of the Bureau, major units, and other subordinate units are defined by the table of echelon of responsibilities.
Chapter (4) Meetings
The Bureau’s weekly work meeting is presided over by the Director-General. Participants include the Deputy Director-Generals, chiefs of major units, and other designated personnel.
The work meeting may be held at any time if necessary. Besides aforementioned members, other related personnel may participate if necessary.

The Bureau shall convene monthly armament meetings presided over by the Vice Minister. Participants include the Director-General, the Deputy Director-Generals, chiefs of major units, chiefs of functional units of services’general headquarters, and designated personnel. Other related personnel may attend if necessary.

The Bureau shall convene annual armament meeting presided by the Vice Minister. Participants include the Director-General, the Deputy Director-Generals, chiefs of major units, heads of subordinate units, and designated personnel.
The Director-General may convene or authorize the Deputy Director-Generals to convene provisional meetings for important issues, bills, and projects.
The Bureau may hold seminars or coordination sessions for functional needs. If necessary, it may invite experts and scholars. Personnel of related functional units may also participate.

If there are conflicts of functions, chiefs of related major units shall coordinate first. If no agreement can be reached, these issues shall be submitted to the Director-or Deputy-Director-Generals for final decision.

The Bureau’s personnel shall request instructions from superiors before attending meetings held by other organizations and submit a report afterwards.
Chapter (5) Supplementary Articles
Management of documents, finance, and issues shall follow related laws and regulations.
The rules and procedures to engage advisors and set up commissions will be separately made.
The bylaw is effective immediately.
